item.title: 红利还是品牌？帝亚吉欧新任首席执行官在解决债务问题时面临削减成本的两难选择
item.description: 帝亚吉欧即将上任的首席执行官戴夫-刘易斯（Dave Lewis）在金融界以其大刀阔斧的企业扭亏为盈而被称为 "Drastic Dave"，当他 1 月份加入这家全球最大的烈酒制造商时，他将面临降低债务和重振销售的挑战，这将是对他削减成本声誉的一次考验。【原文：Diageo's incoming CEO Dave Lewis, known in financial circles as “Drastic Dave” for his sweeping turnaround of businesses, will put his reputation as a cost-cutter to the test when he joins the world’s largest spirits maker in January with the challenge of lowering its debt and reigniting sales.】

item.title: 据 Information 报道，苹果公司推迟下一版 iPhone Air 上市时间
item.description: 据 Information 周一援引知情人士的话报道，由于销售疲软，苹果公司将不会按原计划于 2026 年秋季发布下一版 iPhone Air。【原文：Apple will not release the next version of the iPhone Air in the fall of 2026 as previously planned, amid weak sales, the Information reported on Monday, citing sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特斯拉董事长感谢投资者批准马斯克 8,780 亿美元的薪酬方案
item.description: 特斯拉董事会主席罗宾-登霍尔姆（Robyn Denholm）周一感谢这家电动汽车制造商的股东批准了首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）8,780亿美元的薪酬方案。【原文：Tesla board chair Robyn Denholm thanked the electric-vehicle maker's shareholders on Monday for approving CEO Elon Musk's $878 billion pay package.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：欧盟探讨禁止华为、中兴通讯进入成员国移动网络
item.description: 彭博新闻社周一援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道称，欧盟委员会正在考虑如何迫使欧盟成员国逐步将华为和中兴通讯公司排除在其电信网络之外。【原文：The European Commission is considering ways to force European Union member states to phase out Huawei and ZTE Corp from their telecommunications networks, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴菲特大力支持候任首席执行官阿贝尔；加快捐赠速度
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）周一对将于 1 月份接替他担任伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）首席执行官的格雷格-阿贝尔（Greg Abel）给予了全力的支持，并表示他将继续持有大量伯克希尔股票，以便让股东们放心。【原文：Warren Buffett on Monday gave a full-throated endorsement to Greg Abel, who will replace him as Berkshire Hathaway's chief executive in January, and said he will continue holding a significant number of Berkshire shares to reassure shareholders about the changeover.】

item.title: BBC 危机暴露了英国知名机构的裂痕
item.description: 英国广播公司（BBC）高层因编辑唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的演讲稿而辞职，揭开了英国广播公司在如何运营以及是否还能赢得公众对其新闻报道的信任等问题上更广泛的紧张关系的序幕。【原文：Top-level resignations from the BBC over the editing of a speech by President Donald Trump have blown the lid off wider tensions at the British broadcaster over how it is run and whether it still commands public trust in its journalism.】

item.title: 特斯拉 Model Y 项目经理宣布与 Cybertruck 项目负责人一同离职
item.description: 特斯拉最畅销车型 Y 的项目经理埃马纽埃尔-拉马奇亚（Emmanuel Lamacchia）在近八年后于周日宣布离职，这标志着埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的电动汽车公司又一次高调离职。【原文：Tesla's best-selling Model Y's program manager, Emmanuel Lamacchia, announced his departure on Sunday after nearly eight years, marking another high-profile exit from Elon Musk's electric vehicle company.】

item.title: 美国政府信用违约掉期利差走低
item.description: 美国政府信用违约掉期（CDS）是衡量主权违约风险的市场指标，由于市场乐观地认为美国历史上持续时间最长的联邦政府关门可能即将结束，CDS的利差周一走低。【原文：Spreads on U.S. government credit default swaps (CDS), market-based gauges of the risk of a sovereign default, ticked lower on Monday amid market optimism that the longest federal government shutdown in U.S. history may be coming to an end.】

item.title: 瑞士政府拒绝评论与美国即将达成新关税协议的报道
item.description: 周一，彭博社报道称瑞士即将与美国达成协议，将华盛顿对其出口产品的关税降至 15%，瑞士政府拒绝对此发表评论。【原文：The Swiss government declined to comment on Monday after Bloomberg reported the country was close to agreeing a deal with the U.S. that would reduce Washington's tariffs on its exports to 15%.】

item.title: 波音公司为结束圣路易斯工人罢工提出奖金更高的新协议
item.description: 波音公司周一向代表圣路易斯地区工厂3200多名罢工工人的工会提交了一份新的合同，提出了更高的批准奖金和其他修改意见，以期结束罢工。【原文：Boeing presented a new contract offer on Monday to the union representing more than 3,200 striking workers at its St. Louis-area plants, proposing a higher ratification bonus and other revisions in a bid to end the walkout.】

item.title: 旅游预订平台 Klook 公开美国 IPO 申请
item.description: 软银支持的在线旅游预订平台 Klook 周一在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：SoftBank-backed Klook, an online travel booking platform, filed for an initial public offering in the United States on Monday.】

item.title: 阿维奥美国火箭发动机厂为雷神公司和洛克希德-马丁公司供货
item.description: 意大利火箭制造商阿维奥公司周一表示，雷神公司和洛克希德-马丁公司将是该公司计划在美国建立的固体火箭发动机厂的主要客户。【原文：Raytheon and Lockheed Martin will be the major customers of Avio's planned solid rocket motor plant in the United States, the Italian rocket maker said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国参议院妥协为结束政府停摆创造条件
item.description: 美国历史上最长的政府停摆可能在本周结束，因为周日晚些时候参议院通过了一项恢复联邦拨款的妥协方案，但尚不清楚国会何时会最终批准该方案。【原文：The longest government shutdown in U.S. history could end this week after a compromise that would restore federal funding cleared an initial Senate hurdle late on Sunday, though it was unclear when Congress would give its final approval.】

item.title: Coinbase 推出提前获取数字代币的新平台
item.description: Coinbase Global 表示将推出一个新平台，允许个人投资者在数字代币在加密货币交易所上市之前购买它们，这使其股价在早盘交易中上涨了 4%。【原文：Coinbase Global said it will launch a new platform that will allow individual investors buy digital tokens before they are listed on the cryptocurrency exchange, sending its shares up 4% in morning trading.】

item.title: 批评者称对具有里程碑意义的欧盟隐私法的拟议修改是 "千刀万剐"。
item.description: 隐私保护活动人士表示，对欧洲具有里程碑意义的隐私法提出的修改建议，包括让大科技公司更容易获取欧洲人的个人数据用于人工智能训练，将蔑视欧盟判例法，破坏立法。【原文：Privacy activists say proposed changes to Europe's landmark privacy law, including making it easier for Big Tech to harvest Europeans' personal data for AI training, would flout EU case law and gut the legislation.】

item.title: 诺华在加州开设新工厂生产抗癌药物
item.description: 瑞士制药商诺华公司周一表示，该公司已在加利福尼亚州卡尔斯巴德开设了一家占地 10,000 平方英尺的新工厂，用于生产癌症治疗药物，这是该公司承诺投资数十亿美元在美国建厂的一部分。【原文：Swiss drugmaker Novartis said on Monday it has opened a new 10,000-square-foot factory in Carlsbad, California, to make cancer treatments, as part of its pledge to invest billions into building U.S. sites.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Verizon 寻求从债券销售中获得 100 亿美元，以资助 Frontier 交易
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引一位熟悉内情的人士的话报道，威瑞森通信公司正寻求在公司债券市场上融资约 100 亿美元，为其 200 亿美元收购 Frontier 的交易提供资金。【原文：Verizon Communications is looking to raise about $10 billion in the corporate bond market to fund its $20 billion deal for Frontier , Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 礼来公司与 MeiraGTx 公司的重症眼病基因疗法签约
item.description: MeiraGTx Holdings 公司与礼来公司签署了一项价值可能超过 4.75 亿美元的协议，授予这家制药巨头对其实验性基因疗法的使用权，该疗法可治疗一种罕见的遗传性疾病，这种疾病从出生起就会导致严重的视力丧失。【原文：MeiraGTx Holdings has signed a deal with Eli Lilly , potentially worth over $475 million, granting the pharma giant rights to its experimental gene therapy for a rare, inherited disorder that causes severe vision loss from birth.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息称雷诺正在寻求中国无稀土发动机供应商
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，法国雷诺汽车公司已经结束了与法雷奥公司合作开发新型无稀土电动汽车发动机的项目，转而寻找更便宜的中国供应商。【原文：France's Renault has ended a project with Valeo to develop a new rare-earth-free electric vehicle motor and is looking instead for a cheaper Chinese supplier, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 诺贝尔奖获得者、HPE 和芯片业公司联手打造实用量子超级计算机
item.description: 因在量子计算领域的突破而获得今年诺贝尔物理学奖的约翰-马蒂尼斯（John M. Martinis）周一与惠普公司（HPE）和几家芯片公司结成联盟，共同打造实用的、可大规模生产的量子超级计算机。【原文：John M. Martinis, one of this year's winners of the Nobel Prize in physics for breakthroughs in quantum computing, on Monday formed an alliance with HPE and several chip firms to create a practical, mass-producible quantum supercomputer.】

item.title: 威士卡和万事达卡与商户达成修订后的刷卡费和解协议
item.description: 威士（Visa）和万事达（Mastercard）宣布与商户达成一项修订的和解协议，商户指控这两家银行卡网络在接受其信用卡时收费过高。【原文：Visa and Mastercard announced a revised settlement with merchants who accused the card networks of charging too much to accept their credit cards, after a judge rejected an earlier $30 billion accord as inadequate.】

item.title: 前总统在柏林和平会议上表示，台湾芯片业可加强国防力量
item.description: 台湾前总统蔡英文周一在柏林自由大会上表示，台湾的芯片产业已成为全球经济不可或缺的一部分，并在面临威胁时加强了台湾的防御能力。【原文：Taiwan's chip industry has become an indispensible part of the global economy and strengthens Taiwan's defence in the face of threats, former Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen told the Berlin Freedom Conference on Monday.】

item.title: 美国持续停摆，航空公司周一取消 1,500 多架次航班
item.description: 由于政府削减航班和空中交通人员缺勤继续对航空业造成严重破坏，航空公司周一取消了1500多个美国航班，这是连续第四天取消航班超过1000个。【原文：Airlines canceled more than 1,500 U.S. flights on Monday, the fourth consecutive day cancellations have topped 1,000 as government flight cuts and air traffic staffing absences continue to wreak havoc with aviation.】

item.title: 特朗普瞄准奥巴马医改补贴后，医疗保险公司业绩下滑
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示必须将补贴这些计划的联邦资金转用于购买保险的美国人之后，拥有《平价医疗法案》（即奥巴马医改）计划的医疗保险公司股价周一盘前下跌了7%至1.5%。【原文：Shares of health insurers with plans under the Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare, fell 7% to 1.5% premarket on Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump said federal funds subsidizing those plans must be redirected to Americans buying coverage.】

item.title: 巴西央行收紧虚拟资产和加密货币规则
item.description: 巴西央行周一发布了期待已久的虚拟资产（包括加密货币）交易规则，将现有的反洗钱和反恐融资规则扩展至虚拟资产服务提供商。【原文：Brazil's central bank on Monday released long-awaited rules for trading virtual assets, including cryptocurrencies, that will extend existing rules against money laundering and terrorism financing to virtual-asset service providers.】

item.title: 黄金储备公司指控 Rusoro 公司在 Citgo 拍卖中违反合同
item.description: 多伦多上市矿商 Gold Reserve 周一表示，它向特拉华州一家法院起诉 Rusoro Mining，指控其违反了财团协议中的合同义务，即在法院组织的拍卖会上竞购 Citgo Petroleum 的母公司。【原文：Toronto-listed miner Gold Reserve said on Monday it filed a complaint in a Delaware court against Rusoro Mining for alleged breach of its contractual obligations under a consortium agreement to submit a bid for the parent of Citgo Petroleum in a court-organized auction.】

item.title: 本田的更大威胁来自中国电动汽车制造商，而非关税或芯片
item.description: 本田下调全年利润展望，凸显了美国关税和全球芯片短缺带来的直接压力，但更深层次、更长期的挑战在于来自中国电动汽车制造商日益加剧的竞争。【原文：Honda's downgrade to its full-year profit outlook underscores the immediate pressure from U.S. tariffs and global chip shortages - but the deeper, longer-term challenge lies in intensifying competition from Chinese electric vehicle makers.】

item.title: 法律人工智能技术公司 Clio 在最新一轮融资中估值 50 亿美元
item.description: 法律人工智能技术公司 Clio 周一表示，该公司在新企业联合公司（NEA）领投的一轮融资中筹集了 5 亿美元，公司估值达 50 亿美元。【原文：Legal AI technology company Clio said on Monday it has raised $500 million in a funding round led by New Enterprise Associates (NEA), valuing the company at $5 billion.】

item.title: 数据中心蓬勃发展，塔式半导体公司预计季度收入高于预期
item.description: 以色列合约芯片制造商 Tower Semiconductor 周一预计，受数据中心和人工智能基础设施对其专用模拟芯片的强劲需求推动，第四季度营收将高于预期。【原文：Israeli contract chipmaker Tower Semiconductor forecast fourth-quarter revenue above estimates on Monday, driven by strong demand for its specialty analog chips used in data centers and artificial intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: 法院文件显示，威士卡和万事达卡达成刷卡费修订协议
item.description: 据周一的一份法庭文件显示，威士公司和万事达公司已与指控这两家银行卡网络接受其信用卡收费过高的商家达成了一项修订后的和解协议。【原文：Visa and Mastercard have reached a revised settlement with merchants who accused the card networks of charging too much to accept their credit cards, according to a Monday court filing.】
